All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractClientApp
abstract class for socket client
BoardView
The class represents the view of the game board
ChatController
Controller that controls the Chat scene
ChatMessage
Represents a chat message with a username and a text.
Cli_Images
The class prints the initial image of the CLI
Client
client of the game
ClientFactory
 
ClientInterface
Interface used to be able to use any type of connection (SOCKET or RMI)
ClientView
Class representing the client side view
CliUserInterface
Represents a command-line user interface for a client.
CliUserInterfaceFactory
 
Color
Enumeration of the possible tile colors
CommonGoal
The class represents a common goal card of the game
CommonGoal_1
Two separate groups of 4 tiles same type that form a 2x2 square.
CommonGoal_10
Five tiles of the same type that create an X
CommonGoal_11
Five tiles of the same type that form a diagonal.
CommonGoal_12
Five columns of increasing height or descending: starting from the first column left or right, each successive column it must be formed by an extra tile.
CommonGoal_2
 
CommonGoal_3
Four separate groups formed each from four adjacent tiles of the same type (not necessarily as shown in figure).
CommonGoal_4
Six separate groups formed each from two adjacent tiles of the same type (not necessarily as shown in figure).
CommonGoal_5
Three columns each formed by 6 tiles of one, two or three different types.
CommonGoal_6
Two lines formed each from 5 different types of tiles
CommonGoal_7
Four lines formed each from 5 tiles of one, two or three types different.
CommonGoal_8
Four tiles of the same type at the four corners of the Library.
CommonGoal_9
Eight tiles of the same type.
CommonGoal_Deck
Class that represents the entire deck of common goal cards
ConnectionCheckState
ConnectionCheckState controls that the player is connected through its isConnected boolean.
ConnectionInterface
Interface that expose communication methods both for RMI and socket clients
Controller
The Controller class is responsible for managing the game logic and communication between the server, players, and the game model.
Coordinates
The Coordinates class represents the coordinates of the tiles in the game board or in the player's grid.
CreateGame_Message
Represents a message for creating a game.
CreateGameController
Controller that controls the Create Game Scene
EndGameState
The EndGameState class represents the game state when the game has ended.
FinalSceneController
Controller that controls the Final scene
FullGridState
FullGridState represents the game state when a player's grid is full.
Game
This class represents a Game within the system.
GameBoard
The class represents the game board
GameOrchestrator
The GameOrchestrator class is responsible for managing the game orchestration, including players, current game state, game board, selected common goals, point assigner, tile bag, and other game-related information.
GameState
The GameState interface manages game states, allowing you to perform specific actions for each state and change the game state when needed.
GameTest
 
GeneralClient
This class represents a general client that interfaces with a client factory and a user interface factory.
Goal
The class manages the couple color-coordinate More Goal make a Personal Goal Card
GridView
The class represents the grid view
GuiFx
Class that manages the switch between the various scenes and that contains all the property change listeners
GuiUserInterface
The GuiUserInterface class is responsible for handling the client's graphical user interface (GUI).
GuiUserInterfaceFactory
The factory helps to provide a standardized way to create GuiUserInterface instances, allowing separation of the responsibilities of creating user interfaces from the components that use them
InvalidLoginException
Custom exception class for invalid login attempts.
InvalidMoveException
InvalidMoveException is an exception class that represents an invalid move in the game.
JoinController
Controller that controls the Join scene
JoinMessage
Represents a message for join a game.
Launcher
Launcher class that starts the application, either as a client or as a server.
MainSceneController
Controller that controls the Main scene
Message
The class represents a generic message and is used as a superclass for other classes representing specific types of messages.
MessageHandler
Handles incoming messages from clients and delegates them to the appropriate server methods.
MessageID
Enumeration of the different types of messages presented in the game
NotToRefillBoardExc
The NotToRefillBoardExc class is a custom exception class that extends the Exception class.
ObservableObject
An abstract base class for objects that support property change notification.
OtherGridsController
Controller that controls the OtherGrids scene
Persistencer
This class is used to save and load a game
PersistencerTest
 
PersonalGoal
The class represents a single personal goal card
PersonalGoal_Deck
Class that represents the entire deck of personal goal cards
PickMessage
Represents a message for the coordinates of the picked tiles Contains information about the username and a list of coordinates.
PickState
PickState is responsible for handling the picking of tiles by the current player.
Player
Class that represents the player of the game
PlayerDeserializer
 
PlayerGrid
Class that represents the player's grid
POb_2Js
Auxiliary class used to create the json file for the personal goals
PointAssigner
Class that contains the common goal scores
PointStackView
The class represents the point stack view
PopUpMsg
Represents a message for displaying a pop-up message.
PopUpView
 
PreTurnMsg
Represents a message sent before a player's turn.
QuitMessage
Represents a message indicating a player's intention to quit the game.
RefillState
 
RefreshMsg
Represents a message for refreshing the game state.
RMIClient
RMI client
RMIClientFactory
A factory class for creating RMIClient objects that implement the ConnectionInterface.
RmiClientHandler
class used to see if the rmi client is connected
RMIClientInterface
interface to be implemented by rmi client. here are the methods that the rmi server can call on the rmi client
RMIServerApp
RMI SERVER
RmiServerHandler
class that continuously checks if the server is crushed
RMIServerInterface
Interface of server
ScoreBoardMsg
Represents a message containing the score board information.
ScoreBoardView
The class represents the ranking view
Screens
Enumeration for the change of the screen
Server
main server
Settings
setting for ip and socket, rmi ports
SocketClient
SOCKET clients
SocketClientFactory
A factory class for creating SocketClient objects that implement the ConnectionInterface.
SocketClientHandler
Represents a client handler for socket communication in the server.
SocketServer
Socket server
Spot
Class that represents the space (on the game board or on the player grid) where a tile can be placed
StartTurnState
The StartTurnState class implements the GameState interface and represents the turn start state
StartTurnStateTest
 
Tile
Class that represents the tiles of the game
TileBag
Class that initializes the bag that contains all the tiles
TilesView
The class represents tiles view
TopUpMessage
Represents a message indicating a player's intention to "topUp" their grid with a tile from the specified column and tile index.
TopUpState
TopUpState is responsible for handling the top-up phase of the game, where the player places a picked tile on his player grid.
TrueM
Class that initializes the matrix representing the different game boards according to the number of players
UpdatePickMsg
Represents a message containing the updated pick information.
UpdateTopUPMsg
Represents a message containing the updated "topUp" information.
User
Represents a user in the system.
UserInterface
interface implemented by GUI and CLI
UserInterfaceFactory
An interface for creating user interfaces for clients.
VerifyBoardableState
VerifyBoardableState is responsible for checking if the picked tiles occupy a valid position on the game board.
VerifyCommonGoalState
VerifyCommonGoalState is responsible for verifying if the current player has completed the common goals.
VerifyGrillableState
VerifyGrillableState is responsible for checking if the current player's grid has enough space to place the picked tiles.
VirtualView
The virtual view class contains the various view classes which will be both common to the server and client however the virtual view class its self is just on the server, so a few methods do take model parts as input, while the common parts do not so that in the client there won't be any need to know how the model data structures are implemented
WelcomeController
Controller that controls the Welcome Scene screen
